title.justification: The paper's title is "Compositional Generalization in Dependency Parsing," which focuses on compositional generalization within the context of dependency parsing.

extractions.description: This paper investigates compositional generalization within dependency parsing by creating a gold-standard set of dependency parses for the CFQ dataset and evaluating the performance of a state-of-the-art dependency parser on this dataset. The study finds that while the parser's performance degrades with increased compound divergence, the degradation varies across different dataset splits. It identifies specific syntactic structures that particularly challenge the parser's ability to generalize compositionally.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical evaluations of a dependency parser's performance on various dataset splits and examines the impact of syntactic structures on parsing errors.
type.quote: To test compositional generalization in semantic parsing, Keysers et al. (2020) introduced Compositional Freebase Queries (CFQ).

name.justification: The research focuses on dependency parsing, a subfield of natural language processing concerned with understanding syntactic structures of languages.
name.quote: Dependency parsing, however, lacks a compositional generalization benchmark.

name.justification: The paper's primary investigation is the compositional generalization within the context of dependency parsing.
name.quote: In this work, we introduce a gold-standard set of dependency parses for CFQ, and use this to analyze the behavior of a state-of-the art dependency parser...

name.justification: The research compares the differences in compositional generalization between dependency parsing and semantic parsing.
name.quote: We found that the dependency parser is more robust to increased compound divergence than the semantic parser...

name.justification: Stanza is used as the state-of-the-art dependency parser in the experiments to evaluate performance on the CFQ dataset.
name.quote: To evaluate the effect of compound divergence on dependency parsing, we used Stanza (Qi et al., 2020), a state-of-the-art dependency parser, on the gold label dependency parses described in §3.

is_contributed.justification: Stanza is utilized in the study but is not a contribution of this research.
is_contributed.quote: To evaluate the effect of compound divergence on dependency parsing, we used Stanza (Qi et al., 2020)...

is_executed.justification: Stanza was employed to parse the CFQ dataset and its performance was measured, indicating execution.
is_executed.quote: We trained Stanza five times on each of 22 splits from the CFQ release...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of the Stanza parser on different splits and against semantic parsers in the CFQ leaderboard.
is_compared.quote: Finally, we note that while Stanza was more robust to compound divergence than the semantic parser, it also ranked the splits differently in difficulty.

referenced_paper_title.value: Stanza: A Python natural language processing toolkit for many human languages
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes Stanza, the dependency parser used for evaluations in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To evaluate the effect of compound divergence on dependency parsing, we used Stanza (Qi et al., 2020)...

name.justification: CFQ is extensively used in the experiments to test compositional generalization in dependency parsing.
name.quote: To test compositional generalization in semantic parsing, Keysers et al. (2020) introduced Compositional Freebase Queries (CFQ).

referenced_paper_title.value: Measuring compositional generalization: A comprehensive method on realistic data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset CFQ was originally described and utilized in a prior study by Keysers et al. (2020), referenced for its role in this research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To test compositional generalization in semantic parsing, Keysers et al. (2020) introduced Compositional Freebase Queries (CFQ).

name.justification: The paper mentions using Python’s natural language toolkit for parsing to build dependency trees.
name.quote: Using this gram­mar, and the chart parser available in Python’s nat­ural language toolkit, we generated a constituency parse for each question.

referenced_paper_title.value: Head-driven statistical models for natural language parsing
referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is commonly known in the domain and was employed for parsing tasks in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Using this gram­mar, and the chart parser available in Python’s nat­ural language toolkit, we generated a constituency parse for each question.
